reasoning: Encompasses NASH and alcoholic steatohepatitis. Chronic liver condition measured by prevalence rather than incidence. Global NASH prevalence circa 2005 estimated at 2-5% of adults, approximately 3,000 per 100k (3%). Incidence data poorly documented.
source: Browning JD et al. (2004). Prevalence of hepatic steatosis in an urban population. Hepatology. 40(6):1387-1395
